intro: Malapoenna brachystachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed malapoenna, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, hairy leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
